com.layar.sdk

Class LayarSDKClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.layar.sdk.LayarSDKClient

  • public class LayarSDKClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Interface class used to control and monitor the functionality of the Layar SDK. Your application can extend this class and override the desired methods to get notified of events and to control certain behavior.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LayarSDKClient()

      • LayarSDKClient

        public LayarSDKClient()

    • Method Detail

      • onQRCodeRecognized

        public void onQRCodeRecognized(java.lang.String qrCodeData)
        Notify the host application that a QR code was recognized.
        Parameters:
        qrCodeData - The data string that was decoded from the QR code.

      • shouldPerformVisualSearch

        public boolean shouldPerformVisualSearch(java.io.File queryImage)
        Give the host application a chance to inspect the query image before doing a Layar visual search query. If for any reason, the host application wants to block the visual search query, it can override this. The default behavior always returns true.
        Parameters:
        queryImage - The query image file captured by the user.
        Returns:
        True if the image should be used to perform a visual search query, false otherwise.

      • onVisualSearchResult

        public void onVisualSearchResult(int responseCode,
                        java.lang.String responseMessage,
                        VisualSearchResult[] results)
        Notify the host application of the results of a visual search query.
        Parameters:
        responseCode - The response code for the API call, 0 = ok
        responseMessage - The response message for the API call
        results - Array with the visual search results. Empty array when no results were found

      • shouldShowNoResultsFound

        public boolean shouldShowNoResultsFound(java.io.File queryImage)
        Give the host application a chance to suppress the display of the no results found message. The default behavior always returns true.
        Parameters:
        queryImage - The image file used in the visual search query.
        Returns:
        True if the default no results found message should be shown, false otherwise.

      • onLayerLaunched

        public void onLayerLaunched(Layer layer,
                   java.lang.String referenceImageId)
        Notify the host application that a layer was loaded.
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer that has been launched in the Layar SDK.
        referenceImageId -

      • onReferenceImageTracked

        public void onReferenceImageTracked(Layer layer,
                           java.lang.String referenceImageId)
        Notify the host application that a reference image is tracked.
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer this reference image belongs to.
        referenceImageId - The unique reference image id of the image that is being tracked.

      • onReferenceImageLost

        public void onReferenceImageLost(Layer layer,
                        java.lang.String referenceImageId)
        Notify the host application that a reference image was lost.
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer this reference image belongs to.
        referenceImageId - The unique reference image id of the image that was lost.

      • onAugmentShown

        public void onAugmentShown(Layer layer,
                  Poi poi)
        Notify the host application that an augment was rendered on screen.
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer this augment belongs to
        poi - The poi representing the augment

      • onAugmentClicked

        public void onAugmentClicked(Layer layer,
                    Poi poi)
        Notify the host application that an augment has been clicked.
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer this augment belongs to
        poi - The poi representing the augment

      • onAugmentFocused

        public void onAugmentFocused(Layer layer,
                    Poi poi)
        Notify the host application that an augment was focused (rendered closest to the center of the screen).
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer this augment belongs to
        poi - The poi representing the augment

      • onContentVisible

        public void onContentVisible(boolean contentVisible)
        Notify the host application that content is visible in the AR or detached view.
        Parameters:
        contentVisible -

      • onVideoPlaybackStarted

        public void onVideoPlaybackStarted(Layer layer,
                          Poi poi)
        Notify the host application that a video augment has been played (either in AR or in a full screen view).
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer this augment belongs to
        poi - The poi representing the augment

      • shouldTriggerAction

        public boolean shouldTriggerAction(Layer layer,
                          Poi poi,
                          Action action)
        Give the host application to prevent actions from being triggered by the Layar SDK. This can be useful when you want to handle certain types of actions in your own application, or when you want to save recent actions.
        Parameters:
        layer -
        poi -
        action -
        Returns:
        True if the action should be triggered by the Layar SDK, false otherwise.

      • onActionTriggered

        public void onActionTriggered(Layer layer,
                     Poi poi,
                     Action action)
        Notify the host application that an action has been triggered.
        Parameters:
        layer -
        poi -
        action -

        public void onPopOutTriggered(Layer layer,
                     java.lang.String referenceImageId)
        Notify the host application that the pop-out view has been triggered.
        Parameters:
        layer -
        referenceImageId -

      • onPopOutClosed

        public void onPopOutClosed(Layer layer,
                  java.lang.String referenceImageId)
        Notify the host application that the pop-out view was closed.
        Parameters:
        layer -
        referenceImageId -

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public void onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)
        Give the host application the possibility to insert its own items to the menu. NOTE: this is only used in the LayarSDKActivity. When using the LayarSDKFragment one should implement their own action/menu mechanism
        Parameters:
        menu -

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        Notify the host application that a menu item was selected. Should be used to handle the custom menu items added using onCreateOptionsMenu.
        Parameters:
        item -
        Returns:
        true if the menu item was handled, false otherwise

      • onBackPressed

        public boolean onBackPressed()
        Allows the host application to intercept the back button.
        Returns:
        true if the back button was handled

      • onScreenshotModeOpened

        public void onScreenshotModeOpened()
        Notify the host application that the user has opened the screenshot mode. Can be used to show/hide UI elements.

      • onScreenshotModeClosed

        public void onScreenshotModeClosed()
        Notify the host application that the user has closed the screenshot mode. Can be used to show/hide UI elements.

      • getSdkFragment

        public LayarSDKFragment getSdkFragment()
        Get the LayarSDKFragment instance this SDK client is working on. Useful for implementing your own user interface controls, or to get access to the Activity for handling intercepted actions.
        Returns:
        The LayarSDKFragment instance for this SDK client. May be null if the fragment is disconnected.

      • getIconResource

        public int getIconResource(Context context)
        Returns:
